content: make this one-of-a-kind neckpiece to wear to a special occasion or event or to complement your regular wardrobe the amira crochet necklace is an exquisite accessory that will steal the show find the pattern over at the clover-usa blog check this * link 1 * to view the free pattern **details** skill level intermediate materials crochet cotton mercerized thread size 8 approximately 40 yards crochet hook b | 2 25 mm darning needle scissors stitch markers tape measure ½ button for closure gauge 13 single_crochet = 2 inches 2 row = ¼ inch finished measurement approximately 16 length x 1 75 height inches stitches and abbreviations | us terminology chain s chain s double_crochet double_crochet repeat repeat single_crochet single_crochet skip skip slip_stitch s slip_stitch es st s stitch es special stitches cluster cluster 2 double_crochet cluster yarn over insert hook in a st/space yarn over pull through a st yarn over pull through 2 loops on hook yarn over insert hook in the same st/space yarn over pull through a st yarn over pull through 2 loops on hook yarn over pull through all 3 loops on hook p picot chain 3 then slip_stitch in the top of the cluster stitch notes 1 read the pattern carefully before starting 2 work instructions within parentheses as many times as directed or work a group of stitches all in the same stitch or space 3 * * repeat instructions between asterisks as many times as directed or repeat at specified locations 4 i recommend using a stitch marker to mark the 1st stitch of each round remember to move the stitch marker as you progress 5 the main pattern is a multiple of 8 + 5 sts if you would like to shorten or lengthen your necklace use this multiple of sts then add 10 more chs for the button placement and buttonhole i would love
